chapter.title: Roles
chapter.para: Great events are possible because great people are involved. Here you will find a listing and descrption for all of the roles.

Roles that are needed for longer streaches of time are broken up into multiple shifts. Please pay attention to the schedule and where your shift is on it. If you are having fun and want to keep working you are welcome to do that.

section.title: A/V Guide
section.para: Applies to: minnedemo

Part of providing a great demo comes from the confidence in understaning the A/V setup. The A/V Guide is there to help the presenters understand the A/V setup and to help if something seems to be going wrong. Usually this role is broken up into multiple shifts to cover the whole event. Before the event the A/V Guide works with the presenters to make sure that they understand how to hook into the input to the projector and knowing where the microphones are.

It is important that if you have this role that you show up during the setup period to understand the equipment. The first shift will work with the presenters and first presentations. The next shifts will continue on supporing the presenters.

section.title: Requirements
section.para: On paper this role seems super technical. To be successful you need to understand how to connect a laptop to a projector and share the desktop.

section.title: Start of Shift
section.para: Check-in with the Volunteer Coordinator who will get you set up.

question.para: On what operating systems should I know how to share the desktop?

answer.para: OS X and Windows are needed. Other systems come up but the users tend to trend more tech savvy and will be able to get the connection established with minimal assistance.

section.title: Cleanup
section.para: Applies to: minnebar | minnedemo
The Cleanup role is there to help the core organizers with putting the venue back to the original state. This could include putting away equipment and removing sinage.

section.title: Start of Shift
section.para: Please show up on time, check in with the volunteer coordinator, and be ready to help out!

section.title: End of Shift
section.para: When the tasks assigned to you are done you are welcome to check out the sessions.

section.title: Pop Czar
section.para: Applies to: minnebar
The Pop Czars make sure that the tubs of ice are stocked with pop. They will need to be replenished from time to time. Check on the tubs at the start of lunch, after lunch, and once in the afternoon.

section.title: Start of Shift
section.para: Check in with the Volunteer Coordinator who will get you pointed in the right direction.

section.title: Presenter Host
section.para: Applies to: minnedemo

The Presenter Host is there to greet the presenters at the front door, bring them into the presentation space and introduce them to the A/V Guide. If there are any questions the Presenter host can either try to answer them or pass the question off to one of the organizers.

section.title: Start of Shift
section.para: Check in with the Volunteer Coordinator who will introduce you to the A/V guide and give you a brief tour for the space.

section.title: Registration
section.para: Applies to: minnebar | minnedemo
Registration checks people in, gets nametags, gives out shirts, and food/beverage tickets.

section.title: Requirements
section.para: For our events we use a smart device application for check-in. You will need to bring an Android or iOS device that is able to run the Eventbrite door application and connect to the internet via a mobile or WiFi connection. If you do not have a suitible device contact the Volunteer Coordinator and we will try to locate a device that can be used.

section.title: Before the Event
section.para: Document the process for going out and pulling down the Eventbrite application to facilitate check-in.

section.title: Setup: General
section.para: Applies to: minnebar | minnedemo
Setup arrives before the event and readies the venue for the event which could include setting up tables, the presentation area, and sinage.

section.title: Before the Event
section.para: There is no preperation that needs to happen for the Setup role.

section.title: Setup: Video

Help the videographers bring in equipment and set it up in the many rooms.

section.title: Start of Shift
section.para: Check-in with the Volunteer Coordinator who will introduce you to the videographers.

section.title: Snack Master
section.para: Applies to: minnebar
The Snack Master reigns suppreme over placing snacks out before the Happy Hour.

section.title: Start of Shift
section.para: Check in with the Volunteer Coordinator who will get you pointed in the right direction.

section.title: Video
section.para: Applies to: minnebar

Each person a a video shift is assigned a few of the rooms and is expected to make sure that there is enough room to record and that the camera is pointed at the person who is speaking. If there is a problem that you are able to not fix you should bring it to the attention of the minne* organizers.
The work for the Video shift is done before each session of a shift. After the checks have been done you will be able to attend sessions.

section.title: Start of Shift
section.para: Check-in with the Volunteer Coordinator who will assign you a set of rooms for your shift.
